summary: This bill, the Reduce Duplication and Improve Access to Work Act, amends part A of title IV of the Social Security Act. It allows states to transfer a portion of block grant funds for temporary assistance for needy families to be used under title I of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA) for workforce development. The bill places a 15% limit on funds reserved for statewide workforce investment activities and requires states to submit a combined State plan under WIOA if they transfer funds. The amendments are scheduled to take effect on October 1, 2026.
